docs.lead_paragraph: Leaders of both parties expressed hope that the measure would pass, but many rank-and-file Republicans said they were leaning against voting for it.

headline.seo: Panel Completes Last Details of Tax Cut Extension
headline.main: Panel Completes Last Details of Payroll Tax Cut Extension
headline.print_headline: Panel Completes Last Details of Tax Cut Extension

docs.abstract: House-Senate committee completes measure to extend a $150 billion payroll tax reduction through the end of 2012, only an hour before mandated deadline; measure will also extend unemployment benefits and prevent a pay cut for doctors who accept Medicare; leaders of both parties express hope that the measure will pass, but many rank-and-file Republicans say they may vote against it.
docs.snippet: Leaders of both parties expressed hope that the measure would pass, but many rank-and-file Republicans said they were leaning against voting for it.

byline.original: By JENNIFER STEINHAUER and ROBERT PEAR

headline.main: Birth Control, Bishops and Religious Authority

docs.abstract: Who defines the teachings of the church — the pope and bishops, or the church members themselves?
docs.snippet: Who defines the teachings of the church — the pope and bishops, or the church members themselves?

headline.main: How to Curb Prescription Drug Abuse

docs.abstract: Speculation over the cause of Whitney Houston's death raises the question: What's the best way to ensure that the appropriate people receive the medication they need?

docs.lead_paragraph: The requirement in President Obama’s health care law that individuals buy insurance was first proposed by conservative economists and backed by Republicans, who now shun it.

headline.seo: Health Care Mandate Was First Backed by Conservatives
headline.main: Conservatives Sowed Idea of Health Care Mandate, Only to Spurn It Later
headline.print_headline: Conservatives Sowed Idea of Health Care Mandate, Only to Spurn It Later

docs.abstract: Analysts point out requirement in Pres Obama’s health care law that individuals buy insurance was first proposed by conservative economists and backed by Republicans, who now shun it; shifting political winds over issue have become a major factor in the presidential campaign.
docs.snippet: The requirement in President Obama’s health care law that individuals buy insurance was first proposed by conservative economists and backed by Republicans, who now shun it.

docs.lead_paragraph: Leaders of several large Catholic organizations have welcomed the president’s plan on birth control coverage, but bishops have continued to voice strong objections.

headline.seo: Obama Shift on Contraception Splits Catholics
headline.main: Obama Shift on Providing Contraception Splits Critics
headline.print_headline: Obama Shift On Providing Contraception Splits Critics

docs.abstract: Leaders of several large Catholic organizations welcome Pres Obama's compromise plan on birth control coverage from employers, but bishops have continued to voice strong objections; uproar threatens to embroil the Catholic church in a bitter election-year political battle while deepening internal rifts within the church.
docs.snippet: Leaders of several large Catholic organizations have welcomed the president’s plan on birth control coverage, but bishops have continued to voice strong objections.

docs.lead_paragraph: Majorities in the New York Times/CBS News poll backed an insurance requirement for religiously affiliated employers and legal status for same-sex unions.

headline.seo: Poll Finds Support for Contraceptive Policy and Gay Couples
headline.main: Support Is Found for Birth Control Coverage and Gay Unions
headline.print_headline: Support Is Found for Birth Control Coverage and Gay Unions

docs.abstract: New York Times/CBS News poll finds most voters support the new federal directive that health insurance plans provide coverage for birth control; most voters also favor some type of legal recognition for same-sex couples.
docs.snippet: Majorities in the New York Times/CBS News poll backed an insurance requirement for religiously affiliated employers and legal status for same-sex unions.

docs.lead_paragraph: Republicans and Democrats both claimed a measure of victory as the tax reduction was extended without spending cuts to pay for it.

headline.seo: Tentative Deal Reached to Preserve Cut in Payroll Tax
headline.main: Tentative Deal Reached to Preserve Cut in Payroll Tax
headline.print_headline: Tentative Deal Preserves Cut In Payroll Tax

docs.abstract: Members of a House-Senate committee charged with writing a measure to extend a payroll tax reduction and provide added unemployment benefits reach a tentative agreement; both Republicans and Democrats claim a degree of political victory in a fight with significant election-year implications.
docs.snippet: Republicans and Democrats both claimed a measure of victory as the tax reduction was extended without spending cuts to pay for it.
